docs.title: Welcome to TreeMk
docs.text: TreeMk is an integrated Markdown editor and file explorer that works directly with your file system. No proprietary vaults, no import/export hassles—just your files, organized your way, right where they already are.

docs.title: Why TreeMk?
docs.text:
Your notes and documents are valuable. They shouldn't be locked inside a proprietary vault or database. TreeMk respects this by working directly with standard Markdown files in your file system. You maintain full control—edit with other tools, sync with any service, backup however you prefer.

TreeMk simply provides the tools to make working with these files more pleasant: wiki-style linking, live preview, full-text search, and intelligent organization—all without moving your files anywhere.

docs.title: 🗂️ File System Integration
docs.text: TreeMk provides an integrated file explorer alongside your editor. Navigate your folders, create new files, rename or delete—all while keeping your existing file organization. No import needed, no export required.

docs.title: 🔗 Wiki-Style Linking
docs.text: Connect related notes using simple [[note-name]] syntax. TreeMk creates clickable links between documents and shows you backlinks—which other notes reference the current one. Your knowledge base grows organically without forced hierarchies.

docs.title: 📝 Focused Editor
docs.text: A clean editing environment with line numbers, syntax highlighting, auto-completion, and smart formatting. Word prediction learns from your content. The AI assistant (via Ollama or OpenAI) helps when you need it.

docs.title: 📊 Rich Content Rendering
docs.text:
• LaTeX math formulas for equations and scientific notation
  • Syntax-highlighted code blocks for technical documentation
  • Mermaid diagrams for flowcharts and visualizations
  • Live preview that updates as you type

docs.title: 🔍 Smart Navigation
docs.text: Full-text search across all files, document outline for quick heading navigation, backlinks panel, and quick-open dialog. Find what you need, when you need it.

docs.title: Philosophy
docs.text:
TreeMk is built on a simple principle: your files should remain yours, accessible with any tool, stored wherever you choose. We provide the convenience of an integrated workspace without the lock-in of proprietary formats or databases.

License: GPL-3.0 Website: https://github.com/datainquiry/treemk

docs.title: AI Assistant
docs.text: TreeMk integrates AI capabilities to enhance your writing and help you work more efficiently with your notes.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The AI Assistant provides intelligent writing help powered by: - Ollama - Local AI models running on your computer - OpenAI - GPT models via API - Compatible Services - Any OpenAI-compatible endpoint

docs.title: 1. Configure AI Provider
docs.text:
Go to Edit → Preferences → AI Assistant

For Ollama (Local AI): - Install Ollama from https://ollama.ai - Pull a model: ollama pull llama2 - In TreeMk settings: - Provider: Ollama - Endpoint: http://localhost:11434 - Model: llama2 (or your preferred model)

For OpenAI: - Get API key from https://platform.openai.com - In TreeMk settings: - Provider: OpenAI - API Key: Your OpenAI API key - Model: gpt-3.5-turbo or gpt-4

For Custom Endpoints: - Configure your compatible service URL - Add authentication if required - Specify the model name

docs.title: 2. Using the AI Assistant
docs.text:
Method 1: Keyboard Shortcut 1. Select text in your document 2. Press Ctrl+Shift+A 3. The AI assistant dialog opens

Method 2: Context Menu 1. Right-click selected text 2. Choose AI Assist 3. The AI assistant dialog opens

Method 3: Menu 1. Select text 2. Go to Edit → AI Assist

docs.title: AI Assistant Dialog
docs.text:
When you invoke the AI assistant, a dialog appears with:

Input Area: - Your selected text (automatically filled) - Or empty for new prompts

Prompt Field: - Enter your instruction (e.g., "Improve this paragraph") - Use natural language - Be specific about what you want

Action Buttons: - Send - Submit your request to AI - Insert - Insert AI response into document - Replace - Replace selected text with response - Copy - Copy response to clipboard - Close - Close the dialog

docs.title: Local AI (Ollama)
docs.text:
• Most Private: All processing happens on your computer
  • No Internet Required: Works completely offline
  • No Data Sharing: Your text never leaves your machine
  • Recommended For: Sensitive documents, personal notes

docs.title: Cloud AI (OpenAI)
docs.text:
• Convenience: Fast, powerful models
  • Internet Required: Sends text to external servers
  • Privacy Consideration: Your text is processed by third party
  • Best For: Non-sensitive content

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Use local AI for sensitive content (medical, legal, personal)
  2. Read provider privacy policies before using cloud services
  3. Review AI suggestions - don't accept blindly
  4. Keep API keys secure - don't share them

docs.title: Ollama Models
docs.text:
Popular models you can run locally: - llama2 - General purpose, good balance - mistral - Fast and capable - codellama - Optimized for code - phi - Small but efficient - neural-chat - Conversational - dolphin-mixtral - Advanced reasoning

Download with: ollama pull <model-name>

docs.title: Guidelines
docs.text:
• Verify Information: AI can make mistakes
  • Cite Sources: Don't pass off AI text as original without disclosure
  • Respect Copyright: Don't use AI to reproduce copyrighted content
  • Review Output: Always check for accuracy and appropriateness
  • Consider Ethics: Use AI responsibly and ethically

docs.title: When NOT to Use AI
docs.text:
• Academic work requiring original thought (without disclosure)
  • Legal or medical advice
  • Decisions with serious consequences
  • Content requiring factual accuracy (verify first)

docs.title: Code Blocks
docs.text: TreeMk provides powerful syntax highlighting for code blocks, making it easy to document programming code and technical content.

docs.title: Basic Code Blocks
docs.text:
Create a code block by wrapping your code with triple backticks:

```
def hello():
    print("Hello, World!")
```

docs.title: Syntax Highlighting
docs.text:
Specify the programming language after the opening backticks for syntax highlighting:

```python
def fibonacci(n):
    if n <= 1:
        return n
    return fibonacci(n-1) + fibonacci(n-2)

# Calculate the 10th Fibonacci number
result = fibonacci(10)
print(f"Fibonacci(10) = {result}")
```

docs.title: C++
docs.text:
```cpp
#include <iostream>
#include <vector>

template<typename T>
class Stack {
private:
    std::vector<T> elements;
public:
    void push(T const& elem) {
        elements.push_back(elem);
    }
    T pop() {
        T elem = elements.back();
        elements.pop_back();
        return elem;
    }
};

int main() {
    Stack<int> intStack;
    intStack.push(42);
    std::cout << intStack.pop() << std::endl;
    return 0;
}
```

docs.title: Java
docs.text:
```java
public class BinarySearch {
    public static int search(int[] arr, int target) {
        int left = 0, right = arr.length - 1;

        while (left <= right) {
            int mid = left + (right - left) / 2;

            if (arr[mid] == target)
                return mid;
            if (arr[mid] < target)
                left = mid + 1;
            else
                right = mid - 1;
        }
        return -1;
    }
}
```

  • Copy-paste - Code blocks preserve formatting when copied

docs.title: Diagrams with Mermaid
docs.text: TreeMk supports creating diagrams using Mermaid syntax. Create flowcharts, sequence diagrams, Gantt charts, and more using simple text-based notation.

docs.title: Creating Diagrams
docs.text:
Create a Mermaid diagram using a code block with the mermaid language identifier:

```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Start] --> B{Is it working?}
    B -->|Yes| C[Great!]
    B -->|No| D[Debug]
    D --> B
```

Result:

graph TD
    A[Start] --> B{Is it working?}
    B -->|Yes| C[Great!]
    B -->|No| D[Debug]
    D --> B

  • Export - Requires mermaid-filter for PDF/DOCX export

docs.title: Common Issues
docs.text:
Diagram not rendering? - Ensure code block uses mermaid language identifier - Check syntax for typos - Verify node IDs don't contain spaces - Look for missing arrows or brackets

Export issues? - Install mermaid-filter: npm install -g mermaid-filter - Ensure it's available in your PATH - HTML export always works without additional tools

docs.title: Styling
docs.text:
You can customize diagram appearance:

```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Start]:::startStyle --> B[Process]:::processStyle
    classDef startStyle fill:#9f6,stroke:#333,stroke-width:2px
    classDef processStyle fill:#bbf,stroke:#333,stroke-width:4px
```

docs.title: Subgraphs
docs.text:
Group related nodes:

```mermaid
graph TB
    subgraph "Frontend"
        A[React] --> B[Redux]
    end
    subgraph "Backend"
        C[Node.js] --> D[Express]
    end
    B --> C
```

docs.title: Links and Callbacks
docs.text:
```mermaid
graph LR
    A[Documentation] --> B[TreeMk Repo]
    click B "https://github.com/example/treemk"
```

docs.text:
TreeMk remembers: - Open tabs - Last opened folder - Cursor positions - Window layout

docs.title: AI Assistance
docs.text:
TreeMk integrates with AI providers for intelligent writing help:

Supported Providers: - Ollama - Run local AI models (llama2, mistral, etc.) - OpenAI - Use GPT models via API - Compatible APIs - Any OpenAI-compatible endpoint

How to Use: 1. Configure in Edit → Preferences → AI Assistant 2. Add API endpoint and key (if required) 3. Select your preferred model 4. Use Ctrl+Shift+A or right-click → AI Assist

What AI Can Help With: - Improve writing clarity - Expand ideas - Summarize text - Fix grammar and spelling - Translate content - Generate outlines

Privacy Note: When using cloud AI services, your text is sent to external servers. For privacy-sensitive content, consider using local models with Ollama.

docs.title: Mathematical Formulas
docs.text: TreeMk supports rendering mathematical formulas using LaTeX syntax powered by KaTeX. You can write both inline and display (block) formulas.

docs.title: Inline Formulas
docs.text:
For inline formulas within text, wrap your LaTeX code with single dollar signs $...$:

Example: 

The quadratic formula is $x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2-4ac}}{2a}$ where $a \neq 0$.

Renders as: The quadratic formula is \(x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2-4ac}}{2a}\) where \(a \neq 0\).

docs.title: Display Formulas
docs.text:
For display formulas that appear on their own line, use double dollar signs $$...$$:

Example: 

$$
E = mc^2
$$

Renders as:

\[ E = mc^2 \]

docs.title: Fractions and Roots
docs.text:
$$
\frac{1}{2} \quad \frac{a}{b+c} \quad \sqrt{x} \quad \sqrt[3]{x}
$$
\[ \frac{1}{2} \quad \frac{a}{b+c} \quad \sqrt{x} \quad \sqrt[3]{x} \]

docs.title: Superscripts and Subscripts
docs.text:
$$
x^2 \quad x^{10} \quad x_i \quad x_{ij} \quad x_i^2
$$
\[ x^2 \quad x^{10} \quad x_i \quad x_{ij} \quad x_i^2 \]

docs.title: Greek Letters
docs.text:
$$
\alpha, \beta, \gamma, \Delta, \Theta, \pi, \omega, \Omega
$$
\[ \alpha, \beta, \gamma, \Delta, \Theta, \pi, \omega, \Omega \]

docs.title: Summation and Integration
docs.text:
$$
\sum_{i=1}^{n} x_i \quad \int_{0}^{\infty} e^{-x} dx
$$
\[ \sum_{i=1}^{n} x_i \quad \int_{0}^{\infty} e^{-x} dx \]

docs.title: Matrices
docs.text:
$$
\begin{pmatrix}
a & b \\
c & d
\end{pmatrix}
\quad
\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 2 & 3 \\
4 & 5 & 6
\end{bmatrix}
$$
\[ \begin{pmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{pmatrix} \quad \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 5 & 6 \end{bmatrix} \]

docs.title: Calculus
docs.text:
The derivative of a function:

$$
f'(x) = \lim_{h \to 0} \frac{f(x+h) - f(x)}{h}
$$
\[ f'(x) = \lim_{h \to 0} \frac{f(x+h) - f(x)}{h} \]

docs.title: Linear Algebra
docs.text:
System of equations:

$$
\begin{cases}
2x + 3y = 5 \\
x - y = 1
\end{cases}
$$
\[ \begin{cases} 2x + 3y = 5 \\ x - y = 1 \end{cases} \]

docs.title: Statistics
docs.text:
Normal distribution probability density function:

$$
f(x) = \frac{1}{\sigma\sqrt{2\pi}} e^{-\frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{x-\mu}{\sigma}\right)^2}
$$
\[ f(x) = \frac{1}{\sigma\sqrt{2\pi}} e^{-\frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{x-\mu}{\sigma}\right)^2} \]

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• Preview - Use the preview pane to see your formulas rendered in real-time
  • Escaping - To show a literal dollar sign, use \$
  • Alignment - Use \quad for spacing or \begin{aligned}...\end{aligned} for multi-line alignment
  • Reference - For complete LaTeX syntax, see the KaTeX documentation

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
Formula not rendering? - Check for matching dollar signs - Ensure LaTeX syntax is correct - Look for unescaped special characters

Common LaTeX commands: - \frac{numerator}{denominator} - fractions - \sqrt{x} - square root - ^ - superscript - _ - subscript - \left( ... \right) - auto-sized parentheses - \text{...} - regular text inside formulas

docs.title: Getting Started with TreeMk
docs.text: Welcome! This guide will help you start using TreeMk effectively.

docs.title: 1. Open a Folder
docs.text:
TreeMk works with folders containing your Markdown notes.

  • Go to File → Open Folder (or press Ctrl+O)
  • Select a folder on your computer
  • TreeMk will display all files in the folder tree on the left

docs.title: 2. Create Your First Note
docs.text:
• Right-click in the file tree
  • Select New File
  • Give it a name (e.g., my-first-note.md)
  • Start typing in the editor!

docs.title: 3. Link Notes Together
docs.text:
Use wiki-style links to connect your notes:

This is a link to [[another-note]]

When you Ctrl+Click on the link, TreeMk opens that note. If the file doesn't exist, TreeMk will ask if you want to create it.

docs.title: Left Panel (Files & Outline)
docs.text:
• Files Tab: Browse your folder structure
  • Outline Tab: Navigate headings in the current document
  • Backlinks Tab: See which notes link to the current one

docs.title: Center Panel (Editor)
docs.text: The main editor supports: - Multiple tabs for different notes - Line numbers - Syntax highlighting - Word prediction

docs.title: Right Panel (Preview)
docs.text:
Live preview of your formatted Markdown, including: - Rendered text with proper formatting - Code blocks with syntax highlighting - Mathematical formulas - Diagrams

Toggle the preview with Ctrl+R or from the View menu.

docs.title: Navigation Features
docs.text: TreeMk provides powerful navigation features to help you organize and explore your notes efficiently.

docs.title: Creating Links
docs.text:
Create links between your notes using double brackets:

[[note-name]]

docs.title: Following Links
docs.text:
• Ctrl+Click on a link to open the target note
  • If the file doesn't exist, TreeMk will ask if you want to create it
  • Links automatically adapt to your folder structure

docs.text:

[[folder/note]]                    # Links to file in subfolder
[[note#section]]                   # Links to specific heading
[[custom text|actual-file-name]]   # Display text different from filename

docs.title: File Explorer
docs.text: The left panel shows your folder structure: - Browse folders and files - Right-click for context menu (New, Rename, Delete) - Drag files to the editor to create links - F5 to refresh the tree

docs.title: Quick Operations
docs.text:
• F2: Rename selected file

docs.text: The Outline tab shows all headings in the current document: - Click any heading to jump to that section - Hierarchical view of document structure - Auto-updates as you edit

docs.text: TreeMk recognizes all Markdown heading levels: - # H1 - Main document title - ## H2 - Major sections - ### H3 - Subsections - And so on...

docs.title: What Are Backlinks?
docs.text: Backlinks show all notes that link to the current document.

docs.title: Using Backlinks
docs.text:
1. Open any note
  2. Switch to the Backlinks tab
  3. See all notes that reference this one
  4. Click any backlink to open that note

docs.title: Benefits
docs.text:
• Discover connections between notes
  • Find all references to a topic
  • Navigate your knowledge graph
  • Build a networked note system

docs.title: Fast File Access
docs.text: Press Ctrl+P to open the Quick Open dialog: - Start typing a filename - Fuzzy search matches parts of names - Arrow keys to select - Enter to open

docs.title: Fuzzy Matching
docs.text: Type any part of the filename: - gett matches "getting-started.md" - key sho matches "keyboard-shortcuts.md" - Works with partial matches

docs.title: Full-Text Search
docs.text: Press Ctrl+Shift+F to search across all files: - Enter search term - See all matches with context - Click any result to open that file - Search is case-insensitive by default

docs.title: Search Features

docs.title: Multiple Tabs

  • Drag tabs to reorder

docs.title: Workspace Switching

1. Use Wiki Links: Create a web of interconnected notes

docs.text: TreeMk renders LaTeX formulas using KaTeX or MathJax.

The formula $E = mc^2$ is Einstein's famous equation.

docs.text:
Use double dollar signs for display math: 

$$
\int_{-\infty}^{\infty} e^{-x^2} dx = \sqrt{\pi}
$$

Result: $$ \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} e^{-x^2} dx = \sqrt{\pi} $$

docs.title: Common Formula Examples
docs.text:
Quadratic Formula: 

$$x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a}$$

Matrix: 

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
a & b \\
c & d
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Sum Notation: 

$$\sum_{i=1}^{n} i = \frac{n(n+1)}{2}$$

docs.title: Tips for Better Previews
docs.text:
1. Use Semantic Headings: Structure improves readability
  2. Add Alt Text to Images: Better accessibility
  3. Format Code Blocks: Specify language for highlighting
  4. Test Formulas: Preview LaTeX before finalizing
  5. Leverage Tables: Organize data clearly
  6. Use Callouts: Highlight important information

docs.title: Formula Not Rendering
docs.text:
• Check for balanced delimiters (\(..\) or $\(...\)$)
  • Verify LaTeX syntax is correct
  • Ensure formulas are enabled in settings

docs.title: Image Not Showing
docs.text:
• Check file path is correct
  • Use relative paths from document location

docs.title: Slow Preview

  • Disable features you don't need

docs.title: Export Features
docs.text: TreeMk can export your notes to multiple formats using Pandoc.

docs.title: Supported Formats
docs.text:
HTML Export - Self-contained HTML file - Includes CSS styling - Preserves syntax highlighting - Mermaid diagrams (with mermaid-filter)

PDF Export - Professional document layout - Code syntax highlighting - LaTeX formula rendering - Requires Pandoc with PDF support

DOCX Export - Microsoft Word format - Preserves formatting - Tables and lists - Code blocks

Plain Text - Simple text export - No formatting - Quick and lightweight

docs.title: How to Export
docs.text:
1. Open the document you want to export
  2. Go to File → Export or press Ctrl+E
  3. Choose your format (HTML, PDF, DOCX, or Text)
  4. Select destination and filename
  5. Click Save

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
Pandoc is required for HTML, PDF, and DOCX exports:

# Ubuntu/Debian
sudo apt install pandoc

# macOS
brew install pandoc

# Fedora
sudo dnf install pandoc

For Mermaid Diagrams in Exports:

Install mermaid-filter via npm:

npm install -g mermaid-filter

If mermaid-filter is in your PATH, TreeMk will automatically use it during export to render Mermaid diagrams. Otherwise, they'll export as code blocks.

docs.title: Export Options
docs.text: Access Edit → Preferences → Export to configure: - Default export format - PDF engine (pdflatex, xelatex, etc.) - Custom Pandoc options - Template selection

docs.title: Tips for Better Exports
docs.text:
1. Use Semantic Headings: Structure with H1, H2, H3 for better formatting
  2. Test Before Exporting: Preview how it will look
  3. Relative Image Paths: Use relative paths for images
  4. Check Formulas: Ensure LaTeX renders correctly in preview
  5. Code Language: Specify language in code blocks for syntax highlighting
